<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Read Psychometric Resonance](/Feats.aspx?ID=3776) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=60" />
<trait label="Exploration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=66" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 79</row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)

</column>

---

With a touch, you can read the psychic impressions left on objects by their previous owners. This exploration activity functions similarly to [Detect Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=513) in that you move at half your travel speed or slower while looking for psychometric resonance. You must brush your bare hands over any objects you pass while you do this. This detects objects with significant emotional resonance attached to them, such as the joy from a child's beloved teddy bear, the sorrow from a widower's wedding ring, or the fear from a victim's murder weapon. If you're looking for a particular type of emotional resonance, you can choose to ignore other emotions. If you find an item with that resonance, you can explore that resonance with the following action.

 **Psychometric Assessment** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [exploration](/Traits.aspx?ID=66), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** Your bare hands are touching an object in which you detected psychometric resonance; **Effect** You spend 1 minute concentrating on the object to get a vision of the face of the person who imbued the item with such emotion in the first place. If the associated emotion is painfully negative, you might take 1d6 psychic damage, as determined by the GM.
